verses.verse: The word<WH1697> of the LORD<WH3068> came<WH1961> again to me, saying,<WH559>
Now, you son<WH1121> of man,<WH120> take<WH5375> up a lamentation<WH7015> for Tyrus;<WH6865>

And say<WH559> to Tyrus,<WH6865> O you that are situate<WH3427> at<WH5921> the entry<WH3996> of the sea,<WH3220> which are a merchant<WH7402> of the people<WH5971> for many<WH7227> isles,<WH339> Thus<WH3541> said<WH559> the Lord<WH136> GOD;<WH3069> O Tyrus,<WH6865> you have said,<WH559> I am of perfect<WH3632> beauty.<WH3308>
Your borders<WH1366> are in the middle<WH3820> of the seas,<WH3220> your builders<WH1129> have perfected<WH3634> your beauty.<WH3308>
They have made<WH1129> all<WH3605> your ship boards<WH3871> of fir<WH1265> trees of Senir:<WH8149> they have taken<WH3947> cedars<WH730> from Lebanon<WH3844> to make<WH6213> masts<WH8650> for you.

Of the oaks<WH437> of Bashan<WH1316> have they made<WH6213> your oars;<WH4880> the company<WH1323> of the Ashurites<WH843> have made<WH6213> your benches<WH7175> of ivory,<WH8127> brought out of the isles<WH339> of Chittim.<WH3794>

Fine linen<WH8336> with broidered<WH7553> work<WH7553> from Egypt<WH4714> was that which you spread<WH4666> forth to be your sail;<WH5251> blue<WH8504> and purple<WH713> from the isles<WH339> of Elishah<WH473> was that which covered<WH4374> you.
The inhabitants<WH3427> of Zidon<WH6721> and Arvad<WH719> were your mariners:<WH7751> your wise<WH2450> men, O Tyrus,<WH6865> that were in you, were your pilots.<WH2259>

The ancients<WH2204> of Gebal<WH1381> and the wise<WH2450> men thereof were in you your caulkers:<WH2388> <WH919> all<WH3605> the ships<WH591> of the sea<WH3220> with their mariners<WH4419> were in you to occupy<WH6148> your merchandise.<WH4627>

They of Persia<WH6539> and of Lud<WH3865> and of Phut<WH6316> were in your army,<WH2428> your men<WH582> of war:<WH4421> they hanged<WH8518> the shield<WH4043> and helmet<WH3553> in you; they set<WH5414> forth your comeliness.<WH1926>

The men<WH1121> of Arvad<WH719> with your army<WH2428> were on your walls<WH2346> round<WH5439> about, and the Gammadims<WH1575> were in your towers:<WH4026> they hanged<WH8518> their shields<WH7982> on your walls<WH2346> round<WH5439> about; they have made<WH6213> your beauty<WH3308> perfect.<WH3634>

Tarshish<WH8659> was your merchant<WH5503> by reason of the multitude<WH7230> of all<WH3605> kind of riches;<WH1952> with silver,<WH3701> iron,<WH1270> tin,<WH913> and lead,<WH5777> they traded<WH5414> in your fairs.<WH5801>
Javan,<WH3120> Tubal,<WH8422> and Meshech,<WH4902> they were your merchants:<WH7402> they traded<WH5414> the persons<WH5315> of men<WH120> and vessels<WH3627> of brass<WH5178> in your market.<WH4627>
They of the house<WH1004> of Togarmah<WH8425> traded<WH5414> in your fairs<WH5801> with horses<WH5483> and horsemen<WH6571> and mules.<WH6505>

The men<WH1121> of Dedan<WH1719> were your merchants;<WH7402> many<WH7227> isles<WH339> were the merchandise<WH5506> of your hand:<WH3027> they brought<WH7725> you for a present<WH814> horns<WH7161> of ivory<WH8127> and ebony.<WH1894>

Syria<WH758> was your merchant<WH5503> by reason of the multitude<WH7230> of the wares<WH4639> of your making:<WH4639> they occupied<WH5414> in your fairs<WH5801> with emeralds,<WH5306> purple,<WH713> and broidered<WH7553> work,<WH7553> and fine linen,<WH948> and coral,<WH7215> and agate.<WH3539>

Judah,<WH3063> and the land<WH776> of Israel,<WH3478> they were your merchants:<WH7402> they traded<WH5414> in your market<WH4627> wheat<WH2406> of Minnith,<WH4511> and Pannag,<WH6436> and honey,<WH1706> and oil,<WH8081> and balm.<WH6875>

Damascus<WH1834> was your merchant<WH5503> in the multitude<WH7230> of the wares<WH4639> of your making,<WH4639> for the multitude<WH7230> of all<WH3605> riches;<WH1952> in the wine<WH3196> of Helbon,<WH2463> and white<WH6713> wool.<WH6785>

Dan<WH1835> also and Javan<WH3120> going<WH235> to and fro<WH235> occupied<WH5414> in your fairs:<WH5801> bright<WH6219> iron,<WH1270> cassia,<WH6916> and calamus,<WH7070> were in your market.<WH4627>
Dedan<WH1719> was your merchant<WH7402> in precious<WH2667> clothes<WH899> for chariots.<WH7396>
Arabia,<WH6152> and all<WH3605> the princes<WH5387> of Kedar,<WH6938> they occupied<WH5503> with you in lambs,<WH3733> and rams,<WH352> and goats:<WH6260> in these were they your merchants.<WH5503>

The merchants<WH7402> of Sheba<WH7614> and Raamah,<WH7484> they were your merchants:<WH7402> they occupied<WH5414> in your fairs<WH5801> with chief<WH7218> of all<WH3605> spices,<WH1314> and with all<WH3605> precious<WH3368> stones,<WH68> and gold.<WH2091>
Haran,<WH2771> and Canneh,<WH3656> and Eden,<WH5731> the merchants<WH7402> of Sheba,<WH7614> Asshur,<WH804> and Chilmad,<WH3638> were your merchants.<WH7402>

These<WH1992> were your merchants<WH7402> in all<WH3605> sorts<WH4360> of things, in blue<WH8504> clothes,<WH1545> and broidered<WH7553> work,<WH7553> and in chests<WH1595> of rich apparel,<WH1264> bound<WH2280> with cords,<WH2256> and made of cedar,<WH729> among your merchandise.<WH4819>

The ships<WH591> of Tarshish<WH8659> did sing<WH7788> of you in your market:<WH4627> and you were replenished,<WH4390> and made very<WH3966> glorious<WH3519> in the middle<WH3820> of the seas.<WH3220>
Your rowers<WH7751> have brought<WH935> you into great<WH7227> waters:<WH4325> the east<WH6921> wind<WH7307> has broken<WH7665> you in the middle<WH3820> of the seas.<WH3220>

Your riches,<WH1952> and your fairs,<WH5801> your merchandise,<WH4627> your mariners,<WH4419> and your pilots,<WH2259> your caulkers,<WH2388> <WH919> and the occupiers<WH6148> of your merchandise,<WH4627> and all<WH3605> your men<WH582> of war,<WH4421> that are in you, and in all<WH3605> your company<WH6951> which<WH834> is in the middle<WH8432> of you, shall fall<WH5307> into the middle<WH3820> of the seas<WH3220> in the day<WH3117> of your ruin.<WH4658>
The suburbs<WH4054> shall shake<WH7493> at the sound<WH6963> of the cry<WH2201> of your pilots.<WH2259>

And all<WH3605> that handle<WH8610> the oar,<WH4880> the mariners,<WH4419> and all<WH3605> the pilots<WH2259> of the sea,<WH3220> shall come<WH3381> down<WH3381> from their ships,<WH591> they shall stand<WH5975> on the land;<WH776>

And shall cause their voice<WH6963> to be heard<WH8085> against<WH5921> you, and shall cry<WH2199> bitterly,<WH4751> and shall cast<WH5927> up dust<WH6083> on their heads,<WH7218> they shall wallow<WH6428> themselves in the ashes:<WH665>

And they shall make themselves utterly bald<WH7139> for you, and gird<WH2296> them with sackcloth,<WH8242> and they shall weep<WH1058> for you with bitterness<WH4751> of heart<WH5315> and bitter<WH4751> wailing.<WH4553>

And in their wailing<WH5204> they shall take<WH5375> up a lamentation<WH7015> for you, and lament<WH6969> over<WH5921> you, saying, What<WH4100> city is like Tyrus,<WH6865> like the destroyed<WH1822> in the middle<WH8432> of the sea?<WH3220>

When your wares<WH5801> went<WH3318> forth<WH3318> out of the seas,<WH3220> you filled<WH7646> many<WH7227> people;<WH5971> you did enrich<WH6238> the kings<WH4428> of the earth<WH776> with the multitude<WH7230> of your riches<WH1952> and of your merchandise.<WH4627>

In the time<WH6256> when you shall be broken<WH7665> by the seas<WH3220> in the depths<WH4615> of the waters<WH4325> your merchandise<WH4627> and all<WH3605> your company<WH6951> in the middle<WH8432> of you shall fall.<WH5307>

All<WH3605> the inhabitants<WH3427> of the isles<WH339> shall be astonished<WH8074> at<WH5921> you, and their kings<WH4428> shall be sore<WH8178> afraid,<WH8175> they shall be troubled<WH7481> in their countenance.<WH6440>
The merchants<WH5503> among the people<WH5971> shall hiss<WH8319> at<WH5921> you; you shall be a terror,<WH1091> and never<WH5704> <WH5769> shall be any more.
